Class Kiva

  • java.lang.Object
    • Kiva

  • public class Kiva
extends java.lang.Object
    Kiva represents an industrial-sized roomba that travels orthoganally on AR floors and interacts with Pods that contain product for picking/stowing. The Kiva class holds information about its current position, the direction it is facing, the environemt it itself is standing on, the lifespan of its motor, if it currently is holding a pod and whether or not it has dropped off that pod at the correct location.

    The Kiva can interpret commands from the user one command at a time, and thus, can only validate commands as it recieves them. Changing the orientation of the Kiva does not require error-checking. All orientation changes occur within the current location the Kiva resides in. Taking actions that require error-checking are: 1) moving to a new location on the map, 2) taking a pod, and 3) dropping a pod.

    The Kiva can only move forward, meaning it must change its orientation to face the direction the user wants it to travel. When it attempts to move it first has to check if that movement is to an "empty" location. For the sake of the Kiva locations marked as having a POD or a DROP_ZONE are considered to be empty. If it attempts to move into a space containing an OBSTACLE or that is outside the the dimensions of the map, an exception will be thrown. Holding a Pod while moving into a POD location similarly throws an exception. If a move action is successful, it affects the lifetime of the motor.

    Taking and dropping Pods require checking the FloorMapObject at the Point the Kiva is currently at. Kivas cannot TAKE Pods from non-POD locations. Following this logic, performing a DROP action at non-DROP_ZONE locations or when it is not holding a Pod is also illegal. These conditions throw exceptions. If these actions are successful, they do not affect the lifetime of the motor.

    Since:
    10-03-2021
    Version:
    0.10
    Author:
    Franz Jacob Hernandez (herfrn@amazon.com)

      • Kiva

        public Kiva(FloorMap map,
            edu.duke.Point currentLocation)
        Overloaded Class Constructor. Initializes class fields by calling the other class constructor with the map parameter. All things are the same as the other constructor, but the user can specify where on the map the Kiva starts.
        Parameters:
        map - Takes a FloorMap object. This is needed to assign values to other class fields.
        currentLocation - Custom initial starting location.

    • Method Detail

      • dropPod

        public void dropPod()
        Kiva attempts to DROP a Pod at the coordinates of currentLocation. If successful, the field successfullyDropped becomes true and code execution continues. Otherwise, a NoPodException exception or an IllegalDropZone exception is thrown.

      • getCurrentLocation

        public edu.duke.Point getCurrentLocation()
        The current location of the Kiva, represented by a Point object in (x, y) coordinates.
        Returns:
        a Point object
        See Also:
        edu.duke.Point

      • getDirectionFacing

        public FacingDirection getDirectionFacing()
        The current direction (enum) that the Kiva is facing: UP, DOWN, LEFT, or RIGHT.
        Returns:
        a direction facing (enum)

      • getMap

        public FloorMap getMap()
        The map object that the Kiva will be traversing. Also contains information about the Pod, DropZone, and Obstacles.
        Returns:
        a FloorMap object

      • getMotorLifetime

        public long getMotorLifetime()
        The lifetime of the Kiva motor, represented by a (long) value in milliseconds. The motor is rated to last 20,000 hours. which is equivalent to 72 billion milliseconds.
        Returns:
        a long value in milliseconds

      • incrementMotorLifetime

        public void incrementMotorLifetime()
        increases the field motorLifetime by 1000 each time it is called.

      • isCarryingPod

        public boolean isCarryingPod()
        A state for whether or not the Kiva instance has successfully called the takePod() method on a Pod location.
        Returns:
        boolean value for class field carryingPod
        See Also:
        takePod()

      • isSuccessfullyDropped

        public boolean isSuccessfullyDropped()
        A state for whether or not the Kiva instance has successfully called the dropPod() method on a Drop location.
        Returns:
        boolean value for class field successfullyDropped
        See Also:
        dropPod()

      • move

        public void move(KivaCommand command)
        Makes the Kiva perform actions based on the given command. Acts as a traffic controller for the user's commands. Calls different helper functions based on the enum that is passed as a parameter. If all checks pass and the move is successful, the field motorLifetime is incremented.
        Parameters:
        command - a KivaCommand enum. Must be the enum itself, not the char value associated with it.
        See Also:
        moveForward(), moveLeft(), moveRight(), takePod(), dropPod(), incrementMotorLifetime()

      • moveForward

        public void moveForward()
        The Kiva attempts to go to a new location based off the current value of directionFacing. LEFT and RIGHT values move the Kiva along the x-axis, while UP and DOWN values move it along the y-axis. validMove() is called within this method to determine if the new location the Kiva is attempting to move to is legal. This is a helper function of the move() method.
        See Also:
        validMove(int, int), move(KivaCommand)

      • moveLeft

        public void moveLeft()
        Kiva TURNS LEFT to a new direction based off the current value of class field directionFacing. This does NOT move the Kiva to a new location, only changes the orientation that it is facing within the same location. This is a helper function of the move() method
        See Also:
        move(KivaCommand)

      • moveRight

        public void moveRight()
        Kiva TURNS RIGHT to a new direction based off the current value of class field directionFacing. This does NOT move the Kiva to a new location, only changes the orientation that it is facing within the same location. This is a helper function of the move() method
        See Also:
        move(KivaCommand)

      • setCarryingPod

        public void setCarryingPod(boolean value)

      • setCurrentLocation

        public void setCurrentLocation(edu.duke.Point point)

      • takePod

        public void takePod()
        Kiva attempts to TAKE a Pod at the coordinates of currentLocation. If successful, the field carryingPod becomes true and code execution continues. Otherwise, a NoPodException is thrown.

      • validMove

        public void validMove(int x,
                      int y)
        Validates whether or not the next move the Kiva is attempting to make is a legal one. If it is legal, the Kiva performs the move. If it is illegal, code execution stops and throws an IllegalMoveException. This is a helper function to the moveForward() method.
        Parameters:
        x - the x-coordinate of the Point Kiva is attempting to move to
        y - the y-coordinate of the Point Kiva is attempting to move to
        See Also:
        moveForward()
